Conceptual Design Initializing into AR Object Interaction Assembly Scope of Work Back to Top

assembly made simple, expertise built in.

Prototype Proposal prepared by Paperless for ASMBL ‚òùüèΩ

Scan Barcode

...then identify the product. Once the product has been accurately
identified the user is prompted to allow AR initialization.

Scan the Target Areas

Plan where to assemble your furniture and also
where to put it once it is done.

Instruction Scanning

Conducting a successful build involves an intuitive instruction guide,
generated from the original blueprint,
with visual AR cues displayed to aid the user in tool selection and piece placement.

putting things together

With the tools and pieces optimized for the target work areas,
determined room scale, persistent and moveable objects, the assembly can commence.

Scope of Work & Cost

Conceptual Design - Project Costing Schedule

No Name of Resource Period (Working Days) Total CAD Total USD Rate ($ per hour - USD)
1 Barcode Scanning
2 Product Identication
3 Prompt for Device Permission
4 Room & Space Scanning
5 Furniture Placement
6 Instruction Manual Scanning
7 Tool Selection
8 Piece Placement
9 Step Sequencer
10 User Notifications
11 AR Flow Interaction
12 ARFrame
13 Prototype/Mockup
